_header: Him were better that he ne were ne never born / For life and soul be his forlorn
_description:
Illustrative couplet to conclude a specimen exemplum in a ‘Liber Exemplorum
ad usum praedicantium’ — one couplet introduced by ‘Anglice dicitur’

DurCathB419.Transcription:
hym were bettre þat he he were ne neuer borenfor liif and soule
                    he his for loren
DurCathB419.Editions:
Little,  Andrew George. 
             Collectanea Franciscana.
             2 vols. 
             British Society of Franciscan Studies
         Vols 5 (1914) and 10 (1922) Manchester: University Press, 1914,
            1922: 1.45.
Pfander,  Homer Garrison. 
             “The Popular Sermon of the Medieval Friar in England.” 
         Diss. New York University, 1937: 47.
